docs.lead_paragraph: Imagine that your employer sent you a letter just before Christmas informing you that it failed to withhold the proper amount of income to cover your 2010 tax bill, and would begin deducting that extra amount from your paycheck right after New Year's.

headline.main: Yale Payroll Error Gives Gay Employees a New Year Surprise

docs.lead_paragraph: Small businesses aren't the only ones hit by the health care reform. Hedge funds, large and small, are feeling the pinch, too, at least according to one report.

headline.main: Hedge Funds Pinched by Health Care Reform

docs.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Sam Dolnick, Katharine Q. Seelye and Adam Nagourney and written by Mr. Nagourney. TUCSON -- Representative Gabrielle Giffords was distressed when the glass front door of her district office here was shattered by a kick or a pellet gun last March, an act of vandalism that took place hours after she joined Democrats in passing President Obama's health care bill. ''Things have really gotten spun up,'' she told a television interviewer the next day.

headline.main: In Giffords's District, a Long History of Tension

docs.abstract: Rep Gabrielle Giffords represents swing district in Arizona that shares 114-mile border with Mexico and where tensions have long run high; it stands apart as one of most the emotionally and politically polarized in the nation; residents are divided over litany of issues, including immigration and health care; assassination attempt followed disconcerting run of episodes in district that some of Giffords's friends argue fed an atmosphere that might encourage violence; photos; charts (M)

byline.original: By SAM DOLNICK, KATHARINE Q. SEELYE and ADAM NAGOURNEY; Sam Dolnick and Adam Nagourney reported from Tucson, and Katharine Q. Seelye from New York. Jeff Zeleny contributed reporting from New York

docs.lead_paragraph: This week on the Bucks blog, our contributors, along with some of our favorite sources, are writing about their new year's financial resolutions. Here, Lee Badgett, research director of the Williams Institute, a research group that studies sexual orientation policy issues, shares her own plans. She is also a professor of economics and director of the Center for Public Policy and Administration at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst.
docs.abstract: Lee Badgett, an expert in policy issues that affect same-sex couples and their families, shares her financial resolutions for the new year.
